Caulfield takes centre stage on Saturday, hosting three Group 1 races that set the tone for the elite autumn carnival, while Rosehill provides strong support with four Group contests on its programme.

Rapid negotiations took place this week for Coolmore Stud to secure Group 1-producing sire Super Seth, who currently stands at Waikato Stud, in a deal believed to be worth $70 million. The stallion will join the Jerrys Plains roster to fill the void left by the tragic losses of Wootton Bassett and So You Think.

A strong market with a higher top end lifted all metrics in 2026 at the Magic Millions Perth Yearling Sale. A Zoustar filly topped the day at $525,000, while the average hit six figures for the first time.

A dense card of trials took place at Randwick on Thursday morning, and a number of the runners-up put in the more exciting performances. Media World, Southend, and Campione D'Italia flashed home for placings, while Found The Gold and Peyton kicked off their careers in style.

Excerpts have surfaced from the transcripts from the Victoria Racing Tribunal on five trainers with positive swab results for Formestane, which appear to show critical errors in the evidence used in the investigation.

The two-day Magic Millions Perth Yearling Sale commences on Thursday at Swan Valley, and vendors and buyers alike are feeling positive on the run-up to Western Australia's "unique" flagship yearling sale.

The winning run of Decorum, the full brother to Switzerland, at Warwick Farm was the headline act on a strong Wednesday of racing, with impressive winners by Maurice, Snitzel and Palace Pier also featuring across the nation.

Introducing the Group 1 stallions and emerging young sires with yearlings represented at this week’s Magic Millions Perth Yearling Sale. From the popular Playing God to the three local first season sires, who has plenty of stock on offer?
